CC-2947_syn_1:
Indication: Dx bronch + EBUS.
Procedure: EBUS (4R, 7) + RUL Biopsy.
EBUS: 4R/7 positive.
RUL: Biopsy x4, Brush x2.
Codes: 31652, 31625.
Plan: Path pending.
CC-2947_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Combined EBUS-TBNA and Endobronchial Biopsy.
INDICATION: Lung mass with adenopathy.
EBUS: Stations 4R and 7 were sampled and ROSE confirmed malignancy.
BRONCHOSCOPY: The RUL lesion was visualized endobronchially. Forceps biopsy and brushing were performed. 
SUMMARY: N2 disease with RUL primary.
CC-2947_syn_3:
Codes:
- 31652: EBUS (2 stations: 4R, 7).
- 31625: Endobronchial biopsy (RUL lesion).
Justification: Staging via EBUS and separate diagnostic biopsy of visible airway lesion.
CC-2947_syn_4:
Procedure: EBUS + RUL Bx
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. EBUS 4R (Pos).
2. EBUS 7 (Pos).
3. Standard bronch RUL.
4. Biopsied mass x 4.
5. Brush x 2.
Plan: Discharge.
CC-2947_syn_5: bronch for Frank Costanza. did ebus first. 4R and 7 both cancer. then went to the RUL saw the tumor there took bites and a brush. systematic check done. no bleeding.
CC-2947_syn_6: Diagnostic bronchoscopy with EBUS. Stations 4R and 7 sampled; both positive. Systematic evaluation completed. Right upper lobe endobronchial lesion biopsied and brushed. No complications.
CC-2947_syn_7:
[Indication]
Lung mass, adenopathy.
[Anesthesia]
Moderate Sedation.
[Description]
EBUS 4R/7 (Positive). RUL Biopsy/Brush performed.
[Plan]
Wait for final path.
CC-2947_syn_8: Mr. [REDACTED] underwent a bronchoscopy today. We used the ultrasound scope to check his lymph nodes first; stations 4R and 7 both showed cancer cells. We then looked at the main tumor in the right upper lobe and took direct biopsies and brushings. This confirms the diagnosis and stage.
CC-2947_syn_9:
Procedure: Staging EBUS and airway biopsy.
Action: Nodal stations 4R and 7 were aspirated. The RUL endobronchial mass was biopsied and brushed. 
Result: Tissue obtained from primary and nodes.
